title: [Privilege Escalation] Authenticated users can manipulate others fullname without their knowledge [Team Vector]

profile.name: WakaTime
profile.about: Automated metrics about your programming from text editor plugins.

vulnerability_information:
Hi Team,

## Summary,
When my free trial subscription was activated on wakatime.com, i also found that there is a new tab or features which is the `Teams`, 
In `Teams` you can manipulate again others `fullname` without their knowledge.
as the details of my other reports [[Privilege Escalation] Authenticated users can manipulate others fullname without their knowledge
](https://hackerone.com/reports/244567) This time the endpoint that we are using is Teams, not Leaderboards.

## Steps:
1.) Go to the Teams->Settings->Members
2.) Invite other users on your Teams member settings
3.) Now you will see again that there is `Edit Icon` on the victim after fullname, Click that.
4.) Then prompt will pop up saying "Enter new name for blahblah.." then just put a value e.g. HACKED AGAIN!
5.) Now go login the victim email, and you will notice that the fullname of the victim was change into HACKED AGAIN!

## Here is the PoC Video for clearer demonstration.
{F200597}

## Suggested Mitigation/Remediation Actions

Don't allow other authenticated users to manipulate others fullname.

Kind Regards,
@reydd
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi Team,

Summary,

When my free trial subscription was activated on wakatime.com, i also found that there is a new tab or features which is the Teams,
In Teams you can manipulate again others fullname without their knowledge.
as the details of my other reports [Privilege Escalation] Authenticated users can manipulate others fullname without their knowledge
 This time the endpoint that we are using is Teams, not Leaderboards.

Steps:

1.) Go to the Teams->Settings->Members
2.) Invite other users on your Teams member settings
3.) Now you will see again that there is Edit Icon on the victim after fullname, Click that.
4.) Then prompt will pop up saying "Enter new name for blahblah.." then just put a value e.g. HACKED AGAIN!
5.) Now go login the victim email, and you will notice that the fullname of the victim was change into HACKED AGAIN!

Here is the PoC Video for clearer demonstration.

{F200597}

Suggested Mitigation/Remediation Actions

Don't allow other authenticated users to manipulate others fullname.

Kind Regards,
@reydd

activities.message: This should be fixed now, could you verify before it's resolved?
activities.markdown_message: This should be fixed now, could you verify before it's resolved?

activities.message:
Hi @alanhamlett, This is not totally fixed, You only fixed the invited users that currently on `pending` state, while the invited users with `active` state is currently affected of this vulnerability.

`pending state:` It means that the invited users are not accepted yet the team invitation.
`active state:` It means that the invited users is already accepted the invitation from the team.

You should also fix the invited team users with `active` state.

Kind Regards,
@reydd
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @alanhamlett, This is not totally fixed, You only fixed the invited users that currently on pending state, while the invited users with active state is currently affected of this vulnerability.

pending state: It means that the invited users are not accepted yet the team invitation.
active state: It means that the invited users is already accepted the invitation from the team.

You should also fix the invited team users with active state.

Kind Regards,
@reydd

activities.message: We want to allow Team Owners to change the name of Team Members on their team, since that's a requested feature from Teams. Team Owners can only set the Team Member's name when it's blank, but not when their name is already set.
activities.markdown_message: We want to allow Team Owners to change the name of Team Members on their team, since that's a requested feature from Teams. Team Owners can only set the Team Member's name when it's blank, but not when their name is already set.

Kind Regards,

activities.message:
Hi @alanhamlett, Many thanks for all of your response. You are so very kind person.

 **I'm hoping that all of other security team will have the same as your kindness.**

For me, Your **kindness** is my **best bounty reward**. 
Hope that i will find another vulnerabilities/bugs. ^_^ Hehehehe. :P

As you requested, disclosing publicly now :)

Kind Regards,
@reydd
